node.text:
Showcasing some of the precious herbs that go into our Happiness Tonic (that soon will be available as a powder!!)💞🥄 to uplift mood and magic. Check out our last post for some quick tidbits on neurotransmitters for happiness 
🍃🌵💐🌻🍂
#plantmedicine #medicinalherbs #lattes #barista #herbalism #herbs #plants #adaptogens #goldenmilk #medicinalherbs #plantsmakepeoplehappy #rainbow #magic #witchesofinstagram #farmtopharmacy

node.text:
My beauty routine is 100% edible and derived exclusively from plants 🌳 This is an ULTRA simple, rejuvenative and deeply moisturizing facial oil recipe to support your new or existing natural body care routine. Using a blend of anti-inflammatory and nutritive oils that are easily observable in the skin. as well as beautifying herbs known you boost and protect our skin and beyond. This quick clean beauty tutorial takes skincare DIY to another level of luxury, not to mention it’s simple, all ingredients are nutrient-rich, familiar, sustainable and easily sourced!

Here are some alternatives to the recipe and procedure mentioned:

+ The longer you slow cook the oil the better. You can use a double boiler, crockpot, or a jar that receives direct sunlight anywhere from 1-30+ days. Heat the herbs over very low heat (preferably btn 100° - 140° F for a while (min 5-6hrs), until the oil takes on the color and scent of the herb. 

+ I know that what I’m using is not an ‘official’ double boiler but it works! And do what you can with what you’ve got.

+ Essential oils are totally optional.  although they can be incredibly medicinal sometimes simple botanical oils are excellent for extremely sensitive skin types.

🔥🌹🔥 We recently launched  our collagen booster face oil (which sold out in 2 days!) and will be back in two weeks. Or you can just make your own! 😜🌹🔥

Loved making this video with the lovely team of @freepeople 🔮What other body care recipes do you want to see? 🌾 Share below!

#herbalism #plantmedicine #farmtopharmacy

node.text:
Who loves body butters!? 🌹🧈 This is an easy high vitamin c body butter that’s deeply moisturizing and decadent. Look no further for a truly non-toxic and nutrient dense butter that can be used instead of lotion, as a sex lube 🍑 even for your baby’s diaper rash(!)... and you can make it at home! What kind of herbal and non toxic body care would you like next? Share below 🔮❤️
.
.

Super fun collab with @freepeople stay tuned for more✨

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by A N I M A M U N D I Apothecary on July 23, 2021. May be an image of text.

node.text:
Tis’ your time Leonian beings! ♌️🔥 Did you know that doctors all through the medieval era and Renaissance were master astrologers? Until around 1666, it was required for physicians to pass astrological exams in order to practice medicine. The planets and elements of the Zodiac had roles to play in medical astrology, and the signs of the Zodiac were integral to understanding how the human body functioned at the time.
🌕🔥🌕

Ok! So lets get to it, Leo’s! 
Leo’s plants are bright and radiant. Remedies that fall under Leo are often tonics for the heart, the cardiovascular system, for longevity —  protective herbs that also boost us with energy, confidence, resilience and well-being. 

Remedies for Imbalanced Leo Energy: Cooling and moistening herbs (if the body is running HOT), Sedatives or hypnotics that chill the body down. 

Natural Gifts for Leo: The ability to say what’s need with solid willpower. Charisma, confidence, generosity, strength, vitality.  A pure joy to live life. 

Rituals for the Season: Sacred play, performance, fire and sun rituals. Spending the time cultivating wisdom, and emotional intelligence. 
🌕
Keep reading via link in bio about this Leo season we have just commenced, tonight’s full moon and everything in between!
🌕🦁🌕
Happy Full Moon Beloveds!! 
Leo’s (or those w a lot of Leo energy), raise your (🦁) below! 

#plantmedicine #leo #astrology #leoseason #astrologyposts #witchesofinstagram #magic #herbalist #astro #herbalism #farmtopharmacy

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by A N I M A M U N D I Apothecary on July 21, 2021.

node.text:
We are so excited to announce that our new elixir look is here!!! What do you think? 💞🍃⚗️💐✨a much needed facelift was in order for our 8 alchemical elixirs ✨

Which is your favorite? We care to continuously make the best formulas possible and keep them accessible to all 🌟

Have you tried our newer (vegan) Elderberry formula with powerful antivirals known to support the respiratory system? Or the Shisandra Rose elixir? Also an excellent ally for these times.
🍷 🍂💞🍃 

Beautiful photos by our dear 
@silvia_salvialimone that we love so much!! 

#plantmedicine #alchemy #kitchenwitch #herbs #plantsmakepeoplehappy #elderberry #collagenbooster #immunebooster #adaptogens #medicinalherbs #herbalism #herbs #farmtopharmacy

node.text:
🌟The truth about good vs bad fats🌟 We live in a world where we’re surrounded with “bad” fats… like saturated oils, overly refined fats, rancid oils, with chemical-laden ingredients. 

GOOD fats are ESSENTIAL to our mental and physical health. And here’s the deal, it’s not about just looking up scientific studies and charts about saturated fats, vs trans fats, vs artificial and beyond. 

You can be intuitive about this process by simple discerning btn least processed to heavily processed/refined. You want to rely on the LEAST chemically processed fat that is heavily refined (And this translates to anything that you eat!) BUT, the impact of bad fats can easily be one of the worst things to our body. 

Our liver is one of the key players in fat metabolism and general purification. And here’s the thing—your body is excellent at detoxifying all on its own and could easily detoxify itself if given time and space.  A liver, when healthy, is particularly good at filtering out toxins. Your liver works 24-hours a day and has three main roles: storing nutrients, producing enzymes, hormones, and processing various bodily elements. This processing function involves filtering out toxins and byproducts from your blood, by turning these toxins into less harmful substances, like bile, or filtering them out of the system. When *consistently* backed up with “sticky ingredients” (like bad oils or agricultural chemicals for ex.) it won’t do its natural course of detox on a daily —  then manifesting symptoms of all kinds like bloating, allergies, and even chronic diseases. 

The word ‘toxin’ and ‘detox’ gets thrown around a lot more than it should these days, to the point that we no longer really understand what is truly toxic to us and what isn’t. Yes, bad dietary choices can make you feel bloated, constipated, tired, and like you need to flush some things out. But this doesn't always require drastic measures like a full detox diet. Even small changes in everyday eating habits (like switching out oils and sodium sources) can do wonders to your gut, your mood, and loose excess that you might not be wanting. 

Read via link in bio on ways to optimize digestion 💖

node.text:
All of these traditional medicines are steeped in history and contain a plethora of healing benefits🌺 They all share a commonality as reputed digestive healers, experts at enhancing metabolic function, relieving the body of excess inflammation, excess gas (good bye bloating!), high blood pressure, greatly assisting gut + liver detox, and metabolism.
✨
Dandelion, Turmeric, Mangosteen 🍃and Hibiscus for example are excellent PREbiotics, which are essential for “groundwork” in the colon. Prebiotics are key as they allow for healthy bacteria to grow in your gut. *It was a game changer for me and my often bloated belly didn’t really change when I consumed probiotics, YET once I turned to integrating a wide range of probiotics into my day-to-day foods, I was actually able to fully reap the benefits of PRObiotics. 

 Cha de Bugre, and Garcinia 🍃are antioxidant rich plants well known as ‘fat busters’ as they greatly help with fat metabolism, stagnation and constipation.. Because we live in a world with an overload of bad fats that are highly refined, many of which are also rancid, or with chemical-laden ingredients (and beyond) it is vital we consume herbs and foods that can co-assist the liver in filtering them out properly. Not only can they backup the liver, they can stick around for quite sometime eventually being an avenue for inflammation + dis-ease. 

Other KEY plants to upgrade the microbiome and metabolism are SPICES 🍂🌾Cinnamon, cardamom, coriander, star anise, nutmeg, fenugreek (etc!) are carminative allies, those that expel gas (and bloating!) along with soothing the entire digestive tract. Ongoing 'carminative' are great digestive aids to enjoy 30min before meals to prep the colon. 

Check out our new juicey blog on tips & tricks to boost metabolism, gut detox and a mini guide on oils + good fats.
🍃💐🌿✨✨
AND guess what! Our Happy Belly powder is here!!! Available for pre order now. Check out link in le bio. 

#happybelly #plantmedicine #herbalism #farmtopharmacy #microbiome #guthealth #gut #healers #botanicals #for #detox #cleansing #herbs #healing #plants #plantsofinstagram #plantsplantsplants #medicinalherbs #plants #plantbased

node.text:
🌺🫖Hibiscus tea (agua de Jamaica) 🌺🫖in traditional medicine has been used to regulate the menstrual cycle, alleviate cramping, PMS, mood disturbances, digestive disturbances, and weight loss. 

In traditional Chinese medicine it is often used for liver ‘Qi’ stagnation. Which is essential when you’re trying to detox and upgrade the blood 🩸 and #microbiome. In TCM when the Qi is “stuck” Heat buildup in the liver leading to irritability/PMS, and the body lacks a smooth flow of energy to release blood.

Hibiscus 🌺 tea can cool your liver and release stagnation by purging “hot “bile from the gallbladder. This leads to a smoother flow of digestive juices, and blood, preventing inflammatory symptoms like cramping.

In native traditions in Central and South America for example, “bilis” is also a diagnosis given to those that are suffering of anger, frustration, and heated emotions 🥵🤬which is a direct signal of stagnation in the liver and gallbladder.

Now that summer is peaking in the northern hemisphere, it’s important to drink allies like hibiscus (and rose for ex!) to cool the system down, and ignite circulation to avoid excess heat. Hibiscus is also excellent for those that are trying to curb headaches 💆🏻‍♀️high blood pressure, high cholesterol, boils, and weight gain.

Hibiscus tea 🌺🫖 contains potent antioxidant called anthocyanins, which gives it the red pigment. This antioxidant can reduce systemic inflammation and lymphatic congestion. It is also known to boost circulation and act as a light diuretic. Studies have also shown that certain bioflavonoids in Hibiscus tea have anti-depressant potential! 🤠

Another reason we love taking it with our adaptogenic Happiness Tonic to lower inflammation and boost mood 💞🌻🍃

Isn’t hibiscus amazing?! It’s so delicious, easy to find and easy to grow. Drink up! 
🌺🍷 

Check out stories for recipe!! 😻

Photo by @sculptedkitchen 
#ancient #plantmedicine #herbalism #cocktails #mocktails #tea #happiness #herbs #plants #farmtopharmacy

node.text:
Our evolutionary biology shows us that we are wired to be blissful creatures 🧠🗝 Our brain has a wellspring of self-produced neurochemicals that dictate our emotional landscape, from how we perceive and experience life to our ability to experience satisfaction. 

When we ask ourselves what makes us fundamentally happy, many think of possessions, people or experiences. And although these can be key players, in reality, fundamental happiness is unbounded from experiences and circumstances, and instead, has to do with an inner chemical experience. 🧠🗝

The four main neurochemicals above that have been recognized for being directly responsible for creating the emotions that allow us to feel happiness and fulfillment. Several not included here that you might know and are major to our chemical happiness are: GABA: The Anti-Anxiety Molecule, Endocannabinoids: “The Bliss Molecule”, Adrenaline: “The Energy Molecule”, Norepinephrine “The Concentration Transmitter”, Acetylcholine “The learning transmitter”, and more! 

Is there one that you’re particularly used to drawing from? Which one? 

🤍🤍🤍
Check out our stories for a deeper dive on some of these special herbs that we love and use in our Happiness Tonic and others!

🪴🌿🍵🥀🍃🌵🌳🍂
#plantmedicine #herbalism #plants #foodasmedicine #happiness #dopamine #serotonin #adrenaline #endocannabinoid #apothecary #farmtopharmacy

node.text:
Feelings and emotions are energies that emit powerful electromagnetic fields, the stronger the elevated feelings, the stronger the magnetic field. In fact, the heart produces the strongest magnetic field in the body, 5000 times greater in strength than the field produced by the brain. @drjoedispenza 

Epigenetics teaches that we are NOT our genetic destiny, and that we infact can alter our DNA through the power of intention and uplifted emotions, like love. 

All emotions that fall under the umbrella ☂💞of LOVE, such as gratitude, joy, bliss, happiness, euphoria, ecstasy (and more) can rewire our DNA, enhance our immune system, lengthen our telomeres and extend our electromagnetic field. 

It’s just about crossing the river of change 🤍♾🌬Feeling eternally inspired by the discoveries of epigenetics, consciousness and more by wonderful humans such as @drjoedispenza @heartmathinstitute @brucelipton @nassim.haramein and many more 🌹

#consciousness #epigenetics #love #over #fear #loveisallyouneed #healyourself #happiness #immunesystem #wellness #farmtopharmacy

node.text:
Rose Milk Magic 🥀🌹🤍✨ Known as the “Queen of the Flowers”, Rose is perhaps one of the most ancient medicinal plants known to humans, with fossil records showing it is at least 35 million years old! 

Energetic + Physical Qualities:

• Anti-inflammatory 
• Antioxidant 
• Boosts skin health
• Assists the blood 
• Helps with menstrual cramps
• May help with anxiety + depressive moods 
• Uplifts the spirit 
• Heart Healer, assists in softening and opening the heart 

🌹🌹🌹

Beautiful tall glass of rose oat milk bliss by  @mydailywellness

Our rose powder is 15% off for this week. Enjoy 💞 code: summerrose21

#rose #plantmedicine #farmtopharmacy

node.text:
Life is not just a random series of events that happen because you did it right or you did it wrong. Instead, it is an intelligent unfolding that is revealing itself to you all day long, bringing you step-by-step from unconsciousness into a state of higher consciousness.

Higher consciousness is a state of elevated awareness and perception in which a person has a deeper understanding of the nature of reality, the self and various spiritual aspects of life that play an important role in one’s personal evolution and psychological development.

Keep reading about levels of consciousness  from a recent article we posted, from the brilliant non-dual teacher #maryomalley 🌬✨ link in bio 

#consciousness #higherconsciousness #awareness #meditation #vibration #frequency #farmtopharmacy

node.text:
Good morning precious souls ✨ savoring the healing power of the sun as we sip rainbow milks ✨ 

We’ve got options over here 🌈 and none of them include coffee, although I must be honest with you I might have a cuppa coffee after one of these 😅

We have a happy hour going on at our Brooklyn store today! AND 25% off elixirs (online and in-store) happy hour is from  12:30-2:30pm at our Brooklyn location. Tonic shots, select cocktails + lattes.

🍵🍃🌈latte magic: 

Orange- 1-2tsp Golden Sun Milk chai, to awaken and uplift 

Blue - 1tsp infused Blue lotus with 1/2tsp blue spirulina, to relax and restore.

Green - 1/2tsp Liver Vitality, to mineralize and strengthen

Pink - 1tsp Rose powder, + 1tsp beet powder >> to tune into the heart and beautify 

Base: 
I simmered 3 cups of oat milk. 1/2 tsp of ginger. 1/2 tsp of cinnamon. 1 tsp of mushroom mocha milk and 2 tsp of maple syrup

Happy Monday! 

📷@sculptedkitchen

#plantmedicine #medicinalherbs #lattes #barista #herbalism #herbs #plants #adaptogens #goldenmilk #medicinalherbs #plantsmakepeoplehappy #rainbow #magic #witchesofinstagram #farmtopharmacy
